item.title: Portrait of Eleven
item.media:title: Portrait of Eleven
item.description: Pastel pencils on pastel paper

item.title: never have i ever
item.media:title: never have i ever
item.media:text:
I never
stand in the door way,
lay in my allotment of sheets,
look across the chew of greens and cutlery,
staring very long. these moments bear me up
through very long
days and the sting of our own hot
words. on the nights the sun goes
down on us.

item.title: Mirena
item.media:title: Mirena
item.media:description:
OMG!  I received the biggest surprise today  Many thanks to and for this unexpected DD!!   


      

I also want to thank for the fantastic interview he has given me for SDTutorials. If you have interest, you can see it here: sdtuts.com/interview-with-digi… and if not, you can simply take a look through the page where there are really interesting things  


      


Credits:

fav.me/dckmf4x by ; fav.me/dc9tv8a by


The rest is painted and my own resources.

item.title: Land Under the Flames concept - Hated Mountain
item.media:title: Land Under the Flames concept - Hated Mountain
item.media:description:
I worked as a concept artist for the Land Under the Flames RPG, working on a 'Volcano-Punk' theme, which was a pretty enjoyable job.

(Just looking at this again now, I could of filled the front of the snake in with black, probably would of been a more effective image!)

The Kickstarter is now finished, but for those interested in knowing more, and want to be involved in the next crowdfunding campaign, we have a discord - discord.gg/TDcn2e and a Twitter - twitter.com/landunderflames
item.description:

item.title: The Wolf
item.media:title: The Wolf
item.media:description:
I have no idea where this design came from. Originally it was all about using the lampwork bead from a small pendant I had just ripped up, then there were suddenly eye sockets and ears. Even then I didn't know what it would end up as.
Maybe I was inspired by watching Yonderland at that time, with its wonderful people and creatures!
item.description:
I have no idea where this design came from. Originally it was all about using the lampwork bead from a small pendant I had just ripped up, then there were suddenly eye sockets and ears. Even then I didn't know what it would end up as.
Maybe I was inspired by watching Yonderland at that time, with its wonderful people and creatures!

item.title: GodSlayer Ares
item.media:title: GodSlayer Ares
item.media:description:
On a journey to claim unbridled power, power to rule all the gods, Ares was consumed by his lust for strength becoming the very monster he set out to destroy...
New painting for Smite!  This is Ares' T5 skin splash and also doubles as the final scene in the cinematic reveal!  
The Lore Cinematic was a blast to work on you guys can check it out here!
www.youtube.com/watch?v=FEi79h…

Also if you want to see some alt versions and my original concept art for the skin, find them here on my ArtStation
www.artstation.com/stuharringt…

www.instagram.com/stuharringto…
I'm also here :3

item.title: National Geographic - One Strange Rock
item.media:title: National Geographic - One Strange Rock
item.media:description:
Instagram--->>>>>> www.instagram.com/darekzabrock…
Facebook--->>>>>> www.facebook.com/darek.zabrock…
Twitter--->>>>>> twitter.com/darekzabrocki

Project: One Strange Rock (National Geographic)
Client: Framestore/National Geographic
Director: Neil Scholes

Last year I had a chance to help framestore push the look for brand new National Geographic's documentary on the beginnings of our planet. I was designing different sequences showing how the moon, earth and life on earth was created. I learned a lot and deepend my science knowledge, such a fun and educative project!
item.description:
Instagram--->>>>>> www.instagram.com/darekzabrock…

item.title: Pewter Badger Skull Pendant
item.media:title: Pewter Badger Skull Pendant
item.media:description:
Totally forget about this one!

It's a cast of a 3D print of a badger skull and my first work with a (lousy) 3D printed object. I think I will do more, but it's so expensive to let print someone such little objects.

Sadly the mold broke after a few casts so I can't do more, but I have some left. Ask CHF 30.- (about 30 USD) for one and I ship worldwide. Just send me a note.
item.description:
Totally forget about this one!

It's a cast of a 3D print of a badger skull and my first work with a (lousy) 3D printed object. I think I will do more, but it's so expensive to let print someone such little objects.

Sadly the mold broke after a few casts so I can't do more, but I have some left. Ask CHF 30.- (about 30 USD) for one and I ship worldwide. Just send me a note.
